intro: Aspidogyne rariflora, commonly known as the rare-flowered aspidogyne, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
